revised_title: Copenhagen Plague of 1711: Causes and Impact on the Population
tldr: The author, John Chamberlayne, describes the outbreak of the plague in Copenhagen in 1711, its duration, and its impact on the population. He discusses the factors contributing to the spread of the disease, such as living conditions, close quarters, curiosity about the dead, and religious beliefs. He also mentions the trades most affected by the plague and the efforts made to treat the sick.
